attributes.action: Ensure that children's safeguarding be monitored by specific named professionals
attributes.background: The Woods LSCB review states that challenge by the LSCB is vital, but the government response to the review gives responsibility to public bodies with no named professional to offer challenge or monitor change. Revised LSCB terms of reference could provide this and safeguard vulnerable children.
attributes.additional_details: The best performing LSCBs are those with strong chairs that provide robust challenge and monitor improvement. The government response to this review is to remove the statutory strength that permits this challenge. This government has a duty to ensure that its duties are wholly taken over by a named role/team within or independent of these agencies and safeguard vulnerable children, a team already existent in current LSCBs that could be strengthened by revised terms of reference.

attributes.action: Force zoos to only hold animals that are incapable of surviving in the wild.
attributes.background: Animals should not be in captivity unless they are ill or can not survive in the wild. By replacing all of the well and healthy animals with sick or maltreated ones, we can provide a better quality of life for all animals. The healthy ones by releasing them back, and the sick by saving them.

attributes.action: Ban being able to own, and have a cockerel in an urban area, they are loud.
attributes.background: I have an inconsiderate neighbour, who will not put a collar on their cockerel to reduce the noise of the crow, the cockerel cannot help it, that's the way God made it, but us humans need to keep the animals in the country and out of urban area.

attributes.action: More Gender Identity Clinics. Train up doctors and use local practices.
attributes.background: We need more Gender Identity Clinics and more trained doctors so that all Trans patients get quicker service. The longer the waiting time, the more suicides we'll see...

attributes.action: Make throwing bread and crumbs to birds a non littering offence.
attributes.background: I threw a bit of bread on the floor for the birds to eat, and I got an on the spot fine for doing this, even after I went picked it up and put it in the bin. The council workers waited in the car until after the "offence" happened, they were also only wearing all black with no high vis jackets on.

attributes.action: Create degrees and masters level apprenticeships for art and design disciplines.
attributes.background: Governments changes to creative education could contribute to the ‘collapse’ of an industry worth billions to the UK economy. Apprenticeships in Higher Education should be available as these cover creative industry skills, requirements and occupational necessities. This increases many opportunities.
attributes.additional_details: Academic research by Birmingham City University looked at changes to design practice, policy and education over the last decade and demonstrated that the subject was being increasingly marginalised. The report, titled Beyond Discipline: Design Practice and Design Education in the 21st Century, which was published by the University’s Strategic Creativity Research Lab, found that design was being devalued by Government despite the industry accounting for 3.5 per cent of the country’s GDP.

attributes.action: Reward home working - provide direct tax relief to both employees and employers
attributes.background: Home working is the magic bullet that could solve numerous problems in one. Though it is a current reality for many, home working must be incentivised to drive participation and adoption.
attributes.additional_details:
Home working delivers:

- enormous reduction in individual and institutional carbon footprint
- Increased time employees have with families, loved ones and friends
- eliminates financial costs of commuting to Reduces traffic on UK's roads by up to 40-50%
- Ditto for public transport

I propose:

- direct monthly tax break for employees, pro rata'd by number of non-commuting days (reportedly employer)
- tax break for companies to drive adoption
- subsidisation of setup costs

attributes.action: Abolish financial transitions by cheque between businesses
attributes.background: After having a car stolen the insurance company sent a cheque to the finance company, so instead of a transaction being made on the same day it has taken two weeks. Businesses must always make electronic transactions. In addition to this helping consumers it would also be environmentally friendly.

attributes.action: Amend unfair and harsh legislation against first time fare dodgers.
attributes.background: Many of us have done it by accident at least once in our life. However, getting caught even once now without a ticket on the London Underground can result in a criminal record and ruin the prospects an individual for life! Please help us put an end to this malicious prosecution by the TFL!
attributes.additional_details: Outdated legislation such as Regulation of Railways Act 1889 (Yes this legislation is over 100 years old.) is having a devastating impact on the futures of many people. Most individuals caught and prosecuted are teenagers with no past criminal history who then branded criminal for this minor offence! Transport for London are using this legislation to bully and scare people into settling for huge amounts of money outside of court instead of having a fair trial! Help us change this!

attributes.action: 10k p.a higher earner's income transfer among couples with children
attributes.background: For married couple with children, Introduce a system where the higher earner can transfer up to £10k to low earning spouse to realize tax savings which can help with child care costs. E.g. If £50k earner in the 40% tax band could transfer £10k to spouse earning £15k to reduce tax on the transferred.

attributes.action: If you pay the TV licence fee you should be able to watch UK TV abroad.
attributes.background: In the UK we pay a licence fee to watch TV, but when you go abroad you cannot watch any UK TV on apps like Iplayer, demand 5 etc.
attributes.additional_details: We are now told that to be able to watch BBC Iplayer we will need to pay the license fee. Therefore on that basis we should be able to watch any UK TV content whilst travelling abroad.

attributes.action: Adopt the 'Cornwall' model for all County Councils in England & Wales
attributes.background:
Cornwall, Co. Durham, Isle of Wight, Northumberland, Shropshire & Wiltshire are all Unitary Authorites with no District Councils.
The duties of former district councils is either devolved down to Town & Parish Councils, or where this is impractical (eg: roads) it is taken on at county level.
attributes.additional_details:
There are potential savings to be made in adopting the 'Cornwall' model, as there are many management positions duplicated across counties with District Councils, also some current local government buildings would be freed up for potential residential development.
Properly implememented it would also mean locally elected people would be responsible for what happens at a local level.
There are already some local authorities who are sharing services and this would be a progression of this.

attributes.action: Overseas military action to require super majority vote of two third of MP’s
attributes.background: The Petition's purpose is to ensure a higher percentage of the electorate’s views are taken account of when Parliament considers military action and that only Parliament can authorize the deployment of UK military forces as non-combative advisers in overseas conflicts to which the UK is not party.
attributes.additional_details:
A Parliamentary Motion for armed conflict is perhaps the most significant matter that our MPs’ are ever required to vote upon and as in the case of Iraq and subsequent conflicts their vote has had enormous repercussions for the United Kingdom, not only in terms of  those killed and wounded but in the aftermath, as now seen in Iraq, Afghanistan and Libya.

The present majority government received less than 37% of the vote from just 24% of the electorate at the 2015 General Election.

attributes.action: Introduce new legislation to ban sexist adverts.
attributes.background:
There is currently a double standard in adverts for what is and isn't considered sexist for men and women.

In many adverts men are mocked, ridiculed, sexualized/objectified in ways that would be completely unacceptable if the sexes were reversed.

Let's have some equality.
attributes.additional_details:
See example adverts: http://sexistads.org/#ads

There is a repeated message in adverts that men are stupid, inferior, sex objects and that their role is purely to serve women. This stereotype is sexist and damaging young men and boys.

These adverts would be completely unacceptable if the sexes were reversed. What's good for the goose is good for the gander.

We propose: a "would this be offensive if we changed the ['sex', 'race', 'age', 'religion']?" test to be applied to all adverts.

attributes.action: Make letter boxes for homeless people or people without an address.
attributes.background: In the UK we have a fantastic welfare system. Our country is one of the few countries in the world that provides help and benifits to those who are struggling to get by, but what about the people that have fallen off that ladder? Well to climb back up as you need an address to apply for benifits.
attributes.additional_details: That is where you come in by sighning the petition you will be helping homeless people regain there stability while they apply for benifits. Therefore helping change hundreds of thouasands of people regain a home and get off the streets for ever!

attributes.action: Start publishing summaries of protest messages written on voting papers
attributes.background: Writing a message on a ballot paper is seen by many as a legitimate means to protest or to air a view. Such messages are written as part of the democratic process with the intention of being read and therefore should be published after elections as a matter of course.

attributes.action: NOT to allow Bailiffs to enter property unless accompanied by a police officer
attributes.background: Many people today experience violent and aggressive bailiffs. To avoid assault and humiliating threats, a police officer should attend entry to any property avoiding potential physical harm to the house holder and others to remove all threats of violence or intimidation.
attributes.additional_details: That the bailiff focus on the collection procedure showing respect and non violent means using reasonable behaviour at all times.

attributes.action: New Members of Parliament shall be elected by British citizens living overseas.
attributes.background: Millions of British citizens who live and work outside the country are unable to vote in national elections and hence are deprived of representation in parliament. New Members of Parliament shall be elected by, and will represent, these citizens.
attributes.additional_details: The right to vote and be represented in parliament is a fundamental privilege of citizenship, not of residency. Millions of lifelong citizens of Britain only are currently barred from voting in national elections even while individuals with dual citizenship and new citizens may vote. This anomaly shall be remedied by welcoming new Members of Parliament elected solely by those British citizens living overseas who are unable to vote in a geographic constituency.

attributes.action: Select the Taxpayers Alliance to oversee Parliamentary expenses
attributes.background: As we know IPSA has not had a good record in cracking down on fraud in the Houses of Commons and Lords many time we see the political elite getting away with expenses that ordinary people have to pay for in everyday life.
attributes.additional_details: Expenses should only be for paying staff, Office equipment, and in some cases travel not for paying off mortgages on second homes, meals, etc

attributes.action: Apply the triple lock to existing old age pensions up to the new annual rate.
attributes.background: The post April 6th 2016 pensions will be increased by 2.5% (min. per year) of the full amount starting with £155-65. Pensions being paid prior to April 6th 2016 will only be increased by 2.5% based on the basic of £119-30, not on any extras earned by older pensioners by SERPS, NI contributions etc.
attributes.additional_details: The idea of the petition is to make rises fairer for older pensioners after the start of the NEW FLAT RATE OLD AGE PENSION April 6th 2016. The way the government triple lock pension increases will be applied to pensioners entitled to draw old age pension prior to April 6th 2016 could cause them to lose out very considerably, relative to the new flat rate pensioners, in some economic circumstances. Example when the CONSUMER PRICE INDEX is static or falls as in the figure used in the 2016 rise.

attributes.action: Allow shotgun certificate holders of ages 15+ to purchase their own firearms.
attributes.background: The law currently states that a shotgun certificate holder can own and possess, a shotgun and ammunition from the age of 15.
attributes.additional_details: Counter productive to this, it is required that a certifcate holder over the age of 18 to purchase the items for them, this can be a problem for potential young shooters who would like to get involved in the shooting sports but doesn't know anyone over the age of 18 who possess a valid shotgun certificate. I am proposing the lowering of the law to purchase a shotgun and ammunition to 15 which is the legal age for possession, when accompanied by their parent/guardian who signed their certificate.

attributes.action: Name under age murderers or serious offenders and sentence them as adults
attributes.background: Regardless of age, if you are capable of and willing to take or seriously damage/alter another's life, you should be considered old enough to be named, and charged as an adult. A child does not make these decisions, we have to stop protecting them and show them they can't just get away with it again

attributes.action: A person be given the opportunity to retire earlier on a reduced state pension.
attributes.background: The change in pension age unfairly affects people in the position of caring for somebody who because that person goes into residential care or passes away, places them with zero income after carers allowance is removed only to find it difficult to obtain employment due to their age.

attributes.action: Provide Prostheses rather than wigs for patients with total hair loss.
attributes.background: For seven years we have been asking our health provider to supply a human hair prosthesis that fits can be washed and styled.  Our GP and consultant are fully supportive but at the point of supply the bureaucrats say NO.
attributes.additional_details: Our dealings with the NHS medical professionals has been exemplary understanding  the emotional and mental strain caused by total hair loss particularly in a woman. However all requests for a proper prosthesis are denied for reasons that are unfathomable.  Example cost ( our proposal costs less ). Not NHS approved, (some trust supply). And of course the you need individual funding committee approval ( they always say NO that's their job, all requests made by doctors and consultants are ignored.

attributes.action: Legalise the importation, sale and consumption of coca tea in the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Coca tea is a safe, healthy and natural herbal tea that would be beneficial to UK consumers.

The 2016 United Nations General Assembly Special Session on Drugs (UNGASS2016), to be held on the 19th-21st April, offers the unique opportunity to open up debate on the issue.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information please visit the following:

Transnational Institute - Coca leaf: Myths and Reality

http://www.druglawreform.info/en/issues/unscheduling-the-coca-leaf/item/262-coca-leaf-myths-and-reality

APPG for Drug Policy Reform - Coca leaf: A political Dilemma?

https://www.unodc.org/documents/ungass2016//Contributions/Civil/APPG_for_Drug_Policy_Reform/Coca_Report_final_25_Sept.pdf

attributes.action: Introduce Entry Level Apprenticeships
attributes.background: We would like to initiate a scheme that allows access to entry level apprenticeships for those who may not achieve a level one qualification, Entry level apprenticeships would give these young people a future within well paid , skilled vocational jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
Many young people find school a difficult learning experience, some have the disadvantage of a learning disability, ASD, mental health issues  and or EHC plans which are not fit for purpose, as some young people's progression is slower and requires additional support. Some just have talents that are more vocational. Not everybody is naturally gifted at Maths, English and Sciences.
However, the system works to add to their disadvantages by favouring those who are more academic. It is very difficult for these young people to gain access to an apprenticeship because these require a level 1 grade,on completeion, in numeracy and literacy.

attributes.action: Make tampons and sanitary towels free for females
attributes.background: Menstruation is a natural part of life for almost every female on the planet. The fact that women have to spend thousands of pounds on their periods whilst free contraception is handed out is absurd and needs to be changed. Menstruation is a lot harder to refrain from than sex.
attributes.additional_details:
The average woman spends around £6,000 in her lifetime on tampons and sanitary towels, not including money also spent on pain relief (a further £2,000).

The NHS spends roughly £68,000 a year on free contraception.

Sex and periods; both are equally important and need to be treated as such.

attributes.action: Stop development of new fossil fuel reserves to comply with the Paris agreement.
attributes.background: See for example : https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/27/fracking-digging-drilling-paris-agreement-fossil-fuels

attributes.action: Abolish psychiatric electroconvulsive therapy – ECT - electroshock to the brain
attributes.background: ECT causes brain cell death, brain bleed and swelling. It can cause permanent memory loss, cognitive impairment and even death. It can trigger suicide. ECT machines have never been independently inspected or approved for medical safety, not even by the regulators for the UK - MHRA or the US – FDA.
attributes.additional_details: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is a psychiatric procedure where up to 400 volts is put through the brain for up to 8 seconds causing an epileptic fit purportedly to relieve mental distress.   Mainly given to women and the elderly, sometimes to children and often without consent.  Patients are rarely fully informed about the potential harm.  Dr Peter Breggin states ECT produces a ‘closed head injury high’ www.ectresources.org. Abolish ECT. www.speakoutagainstpsychiatry.org

attributes.action: Restrict the ability to freely purchase sperm on Internet websites and now apps
attributes.background: It is grossly unacceptable to completely disregard a mans ability and purpose to father children. Women have the ability to freely browse Internet websites and now mobile apps for sprem based on specific requirements of donors eg height, IQ, race "without a medical reason". It's morally wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
I don't want to promote the websites and/or apps but it's free to download and sperm can be bought for the price of £950 at the click of a button without a medical reason.
If this catches on it could be a huge problem that would leave men unable to naturally father children and I find this seriously disturbing.

attributes.action: Make it possible  to  pay a modest amount as extra tax  to fund the NHS
attributes.background: So many of us deplore the state of the health service, and the conditions in which  committed professional staff are expected to fulfil the role. Allowing individuals to commit a dedicated amount each month specifically to be spent on the NHS  could correct this .

attributes.action: Get the government to licence the use of PD-1 immunotherapy to treat cancer
attributes.background: I was shocked to learn of a 36 year old woman who had to pay £50K for this to treat secondary lung cancer following treatment for Breast Cancer. It should be available in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: My Oncologist agrees it works.

attributes.action: Make swimming lessons avaliable in all schools
attributes.background: My daughter recently started school I was shocked to find that the school has no Intention to add swimming lessons to its classes surely it's in childrens best interests to ensure they can swim after all how many children drown due to the fact they can't swim
attributes.additional_details: About one in five people who die from drowning are children 14 and. Under

attributes.action: Hinckley power station should be funded by the UK.
attributes.background: The country is asking foreign powers to provide and control our nuclear power. The rates of interest on the money put up is 9% and the guaranteed rate for electricity produced is such that we will suffer  from higher energy prices.
attributes.additional_details: Savers cannot obtain virtually any interest on their savings. They should be offered the opportunity of funding the project secured by the government at a rate of half that demanded by the French and Chinese. This would nevertheless allow them to invest in a project needed by the country but offering them  a reasonable return on their capital.

attributes.action: Entirely ban the use of BPA for the packaging of any product sold in UK
attributes.background:
BPA stands for bisphenol A. It is found in plastics that are used in containers that store food and beverages like water bottles. 
Exposure to BPA is a concern because of health effects on the brain, behavior and prostate gland of fetuses, infants & children. Also links to infertility & cancer
attributes.additional_details:
Additional research suggests a possible link between BPA and increased blood pressure , cancer, infertility and birth defects.

http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/221205.php

The human experiment - documentary that can be found on Netflix / you tube

attributes.action: Dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a new appointment process
attributes.background: We are in a situation where the house of commons appears to not represent the working class people of Great Britain. It is seen by most working class people to be an extension of the House of Lords. We need a balance of wealthy people and poor people to correctly govern the UK.
attributes.additional_details: At present we have no balance, both houses are full of highly educated individuals most from privileged backgrounds.To restore balance we need a house to represent the not so fortunate of the UK i.e low paid workers, people who live in poorer areas,  people without an education, people without the chance to change their lives. I propose we dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a cross section of society who are selected in much the same way we already make selections for Jury service.

attributes.action: Put a max of £1200 on car insurance for 18-25 year olds
attributes.background: Insurance companies are making it harder and harder for people aged 18-25 years of age to start driving. I myself am looking at a £2500 insurance for my first year driving which is completely unaffordable as i am earning minimum wage £5.30 per hour and am also having to pay bill for my property.

attributes.action: DLA low rate mobility and standard rate pip mobility entitled to a free car
attributes.background: Everybody on mobility part PIP/DLA low rate should be entitled to a free car

attributes.action: Investigate the standard of care provided by local CFS ME services in the uk.
attributes.background: Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) / myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME), is a debilitating disease that causes many symptoms including severe fatigue. The quality of care appears to be perticually poor in the uk, especially in rural counties, with some services acting outside of nice guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience with my local CFS service has been extremely poor, I was 16 when diagnosed and until I was 18 I was seen 3 times be a children's OT. All that my local CFS service offers is an initial information session (the information was mostly wrong), an initial assessment and a 6 week managing life styles group, this is completely contradictory to the NICE guideline. And they do not offer CBT or GET, 2 of the 3 treatments recommended by NICE. This is not the only service like this!

attributes.action: Abolish PMQs and replace with legal requirement to attend select committees.
attributes.background: PMQs no longer serve any useful constitutional purpose. The weekly event has desended into nothing more than political pantomime. Instead to enforce proper democratic accountability the PM should be obliged to attend the Home, foreign and treasury select committee for an hour each per month.

attributes.action: Take care of our Homeless before  housing  20,000 Syrian Refugees
attributes.background: The Government have announced that local authorities have found enough properties to house 20,000 Syrian Refugees,
attributes.additional_details: This is disgusting we have homeless people including ex members of the armed forces who have fought for this country who have nowhere to live and yet they want to home people from abroad who have never paid anything into the system getting not only free houses but no doubt benefits that we pay for as well

attributes.action: Up the fine for driving using a mobile to six points off license and £500.
attributes.background: Everyday I see dozens of drivers flouting this law and families are wrecked as a result. The present penalties are woefully inadequate and provide very little deterrent.

attributes.action: Scrap the 7 day week NHS proposals or fund them by the amount the BMA requires.
attributes.background: The "7 day week" proposals would stretch the already stretched resources and people of the NHS well past breaking point, and do Not provide the funding and staff required. The petition to have Mr Hunt removed was brushed aside, can we at least agree his policies need removing?
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is in the proposals themselves and the medical practitioner's need to strike over such an unreasonable contract. No further evidence of inadequate provision is required, the burden of proof lies with those trying to push through the contract.
The BMA are the organisation representing the NHS and it's staff.

attributes.action: Make learning a foreign language compulsory from the 1st year of primary school
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest levels of multi-linguistic speakers. By keeping up with our European neighbours we will open up travel for the individual and business for the nation. The best way to learn a foreign language is to learn continuously from a young age, when the brain is most capable.
attributes.additional_details: Communication is key in international business and the UK government wishes to see more students taking up a foreign language at university. To facilitate a future nation of polyglots we need to prioritise foreign language as a core subject for children. Starting from the age of 5, or younger, when it's easiest to learn, and to be taught continuously through to adolescence so that every future adult has at least basic secondary language skills.

attributes.action: Provide statistical report of areas / numbers of culled badgers hosting TB.
attributes.background: The Government failed to test culled badgers to measure the percentage hosting tuberculosis & the most affected areas.  This data is key. UK Government ignored advice of Wildlife Experts by continuing the Badger cull. Other wildlife such as Deer host TB, so the badger cull policy is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all efforts by wildlife experts to stop the badger cull the Government continues with a badly devised scheme to reduce TB.  The most important data was never obtained. Recording the number of affected culled badgers and the areas where TB was most prevalent is surely crucial for developing a strategy to reduce Bovine TB.  A statistical report will show where number of TB hosts are more severe.  Joined up interventions such as vaccinations and bio-security on farms are needed.

attributes.action: Instruct Southern Rail to reinvest all profits until they can run a full service
attributes.background: Southern Rail have been running a minimal and intermittant service while harvesting almost £100m in profit. Many of us will have had sympathy that they were dealing with a difficult situation with engineering work and civil action, however news that they are making such a profit shows otherwise.

attributes.action: Greater emphasis of nutrition & health education within the National Curriculum
attributes.background: Good nutrition is essential to optimise growth and development, and for the general well-being of all people. It should be a priority within the N.C in light of increasing rates of obesity, diabetes, cancer and other conditions. A large percentage of the population are uneducated on nutrition.
attributes.additional_details: Health education should be a core principle within the curriculum. Starting from KS1, children should learn the importance of food and how to cook simple receipes. Throughout the stages, students should learn how to cook a variety of healthy dishes, the importance of macro and micro nutrients, physiological and psychological impacts, body measurements, dietetics, metabolism etc. This should come within education. Many families/homes are now uneducated in this and heavily rely on processed foods.

attributes.action: Give college/sixth form students loans just like university students
attributes.background: Many people can not attend college sometimes due to not being able to afford things like the bus or metro, and not everybody is eligible for the bursary. However, the bursary is not enough for some people, for example £14 a week can not cover a £20 weekly bus pass.
attributes.additional_details: In addition, many students struggle to buy things such as notebooks and pens and textbooks needed to study. How is it fair that uni students can get loans yet we can't? We would pay it back once we completed studies and got jobs; it's very hard for a 16/17 year old to get a job these days especially without experience. It is very hard to get a job to support ourselves whilst studying a levels- it is simply too stressful which could effect our results and futures.

attributes.action: Introduce Mobile phone jammers into prisons to stop prisoners taunting victims
attributes.background: There has been an increase in prisoners taunting victims, intimidating witnesses and accessing social media. Introducing mobile phone jammers into prisons would rectify this with the flick of a button.
attributes.additional_details: The Secretary of state for justice needs to introduce Mobile phone jammers which would stop all prisoners accessing the internet via smart phones and making calls.

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016.
attributes.background:
Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016. Legal highs have been around for 20 years until the unsubstantiated hype of dangers.

We are in an era where countries are criminalising drugs and with this act the UK has gone backwards because of unsubstantiated hype.
attributes.additional_details:
We now know that former legal highs are available illegally and have become more dangerous. The industry still exists. It is wasting police time and resources when we should be focusing on terror and more important matters. Even the UN says drugs should be decriminalised.

UK Parliament has made more people into criminals when it is supposed to be criminal justice reform. The Equalities Commission & the PM said coloured people are more likely to go to jail this is racist legislation.
